security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing D3.js visualization examples and best practices. It contains no executable code, network calls, file operations, or system access. The skill is purely educational content about data visualization techniques.

content.value_statement: Build custom, interactive data visualizations without relying on pre-made chart libraries. This skill guides you through creating responsive charts, graphs, and geographic maps using D3.js for maximum flexibility and control.
actual_capabilities: Generates D3.js code for bar, line, and pie charts
Creates interactive tooltips and zoom/pan functionality
Provides scale selection guidance for different data types
Lists color schemes and accessibility best practices
limitations: Does not include data processing or cleaning
Limited to D3.js v7 syntax and patterns

use_cases.title: Custom Business Dashboards
use_cases.description: Create tailored visualizations for KPIs and metrics that standard chart libraries cannot handle.

use_cases.title: Interactive Data Explorers
use_cases.description: Build zoomable, pannable visualizations for large datasets with custom interactions.

use_cases.title: Publication-Quality Graphics
use_cases.description: Generate precise, customizable charts for academic papers and presentations.

best_practices: Always validate data for null/undefined values before rendering
Use ResizeObserver for responsive charts that adapt to container size
Clean up previous renderings before drawing new data to prevent memory leaks
anti_patterns: Avoid rendering thousands of DOM elements - switch to Canvas for performance
Do not hardcode dimensions - make charts responsive to their containers
Never skip data validation - always handle edge cases and invalid inputs

faq.question: Which D3.js version does this skill use?
faq.answer: The examples use D3.js v7 syntax and patterns. For v6 or earlier, some method names may differ.

faq.question: Can I create 3D visualizations with this?
faq.answer: No, D3.js specializes in 2D SVG-based graphics. For 3D visualizations, consider Three.js instead.

faq.question: How do I integrate these charts with React?
faq.answer: Use useEffect hooks to initialize D3 visualizations and useRef to access DOM elements for rendering.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only provides code examples. No data is transmitted or stored externally.

faq.question: Why are my charts not displaying?
faq.answer: Check that your data is properly formatted, SVG container exists, and you've included the D3.js library.

faq.question: How does this compare to Chart.js?
faq.answer: D3.js offers complete customization freedom but requires more code. Chart.js provides ready-made charts with less flexibility.
